newsitem.title: USA: U.S. reserve assets fell to $67.22 bln in March.
newsitem.headline: U.S. reserve assets fell to $67.22 bln in March.

text.p: The Treasury Department said on Monday that U.S. reserve assets fell $259 million in March to $67.22 billion from $67.48 billion in February.
The department said U.S. holdings of foreign currencies were down to $32.45 billion in March from $32.53 billion in February.
Gold stock totaled $11.05 billion in both months.
Special Drawing Rights with the International Monetary Fund rose to $9.88 billion in March from $9.87 billion.
The value of the U.S. reserve position with the IMF fell to $13.85 billion in March from $14.04 billion in February.
